attributes.action: Shutdown the Vedanta Sterlite Copper an illegal smelter in Tamil Nadu, India
attributes.additional_details: Vedanta Sterlite’s copper smelter's  Environmental Impact Assessment was a sham, and coastal regulations forbidding the location of industrial plant within 25km of the Gulf of Mannar biosphere reserve was  ignored. Reports of  illegal waste dumps around the town, and closest port data revealed usage of  highly contaminated imported copper concentrates and disposing its waste into the sensitive Gulf of Mannar Biosphere Reserve,full of coral reefs and mangrove forests causing irreversible damage .
attributes.background: British company Vedanta Sterlite Copper  begun construction of a new 4 million tonne/year smelter almost doubling their capacity, but  the existing smelter has continuously polluted their water and air since 1996, causing respiratory,dermal infections and other illness especially among children.

rejection.details:
This would be a decision for India, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could start a new petition asking for the UK Government to raise this issue with the Government of India.
